page.title: 01GENERAL INTRODUCTION
page.content:
The area covered by this part of the survey is almost entirely covered by intensively managed grassland. One corner of the area includes a part of Iron Acton village. The village is now occupied mostly by the families of people who work in the nearby city of Bristol. The village has a church, two pubs and a small police station, plus a village store cum Post Office, and a tiny school
The bulk of the inhabitants however do their shopping in the nearby new town of Yate, or in the city of Bristol. The only industry, other than farming, represented in the area is the electricity sub-station. Here the very high voltage electricity (approximately 250,000 volts) from the nuclear power station at Oldbury is
